intro: Neoregelia compacta, commonly known as the compact neoregelia, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Bromeliaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves that form a water-holding tank. The plant produces vibrant, long-lasting flowers in shades of red, orange, and yellow, which bloom from the center of the rosette. Its foliage is often variegated with silver or white markings, adding visual interest. Neoregelia compacta thrives in bright, indirect light and requires high humidity to flourish.
